yes, these should be actuals
will delete non-actuals
there is no update based on recent releases
Welcome gift analysis still needs to be done
Search & prod cards too early
@U03TY4YJU4X @U01AKGWGLC8 last year the CVA was based on BC because we don't have the forecasting capability. CRs are actuals
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G0cQvbiWFmVD0t8bO0aahHARk9XbUu3zXAa7MRy_QeY/edit?gid=465841548#gid=465841548
Um, I don't think that's true though? We simply calculated the CVA impact based on the change. Sure they weren't "true" actuals; but at least based on visible results from baseline

if you see the numbers and click on the BC, they are exactly matched. So at least that's how we keep track for CVA last year. I'm fine changing the way we track it for this year, but the target was calculated based on that assumption

Wait. OK, let's take a step back -
1. @U07VDFEFBQU - how did you calculate them yesterday?
2. @U01AKGWGLC8 - how are you proposing we should calculate?

For best value we know definitively we saw +2.5% increase in CVR
-> We apply this based on the baseline values for 2025.

> We simply calculated the CVA impact based on the change. Sure they weren't "true" actuals; but at least based on visible results from baseline
^so exactly this

we shouldn't be linking CVA based on the business case if we haven't seen that result actually materialized

Previously the business case was being linked

it's the same way in 2024

Example https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oZlUYRKGCfxvgJqjDm0Uqh7e0t6P75q692Sk9MIbmTE/edit?gid=1678930848#gid=1678930848 is being linked to the BC with the actual results entered from statsig. The source data for the +9.6% is based on Statsig, not based on the business case before results came in

ahhh ok my bad, then my assumptions were wrong
1. We get the results from statsig 
2. Apply the change to the BC with "baseline" numbers assumption
3. Then we get the approximate CVA result :+1:

yes and normally I don't directly change the BC if we had one - I duplicate it and add "Results" at the end so that we can always keep track of how our estimations compared with actuals once we have them
Let's continue discussion https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C05L8G8AL7N/p1751450211182529?thread_ts=1742562723.612159&cid=C05L8G8AL7N

messages.text: hey folks, do we use plan types in TPT/GoC?
messages.raw_text: hey folks, do we use plan types in TPT/GoC?

thread_replies.text: We use plan types in TPT: it can be Fresh, Dry, Mixed,
and @U07VDFEFBQU @U01AKGWGLC8 - I don’t think we do on Good Chop do we
no, effectively our plans are simply number of cuts but nothing like preferences
@U03UMPD2NNS are you sure we use the “plan_type” entity? PA is reporting that we don’t actually use plan_types on the subscription level as even in the case of multipet they are of the same type

Can you give more context here - what plan_type do you mean exactly, where is the question coming from?

We are using plan_type, checked in our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/3869180383/The+Pets+Table+-+SKU+Menu+and+Recipe+Mapping and confirmed with Ahmed, but depending on the context maybe the way we use it can be different?
yes, exactly the plan type used in TPT is baked into the SKU; this isn't a separate plan_type value (https://docs.google.com/document/d/10a5h-JWqe8OTITLJacLXZrHnwJDYZquzjM0DKuBy0Tw/edit?usp=sharing)

thread_replies.text:
@U03TY4YJU4X let's discuss how we want to measure welcome gifts impact

In the end we do have concrete numbers based on marketing channels but it's also a marketing decision on how they scale these campaigns - scaling is always gradual so it won't make sense to do a pre-post
do we have to translate impact to a CVA number or can we not just report CVR/CAC improvements vs BAU in certain channels?
or we translate the uplifts on specific marketing campaigns into a CVA value but it would not amount to much yet if it's only a few campaigns in a few channels

1. We need to have a CVA number as it's in the KR definition
2. We can calculate the CVA by CVR/CAC impacts on known channels and scale it to all (and add a comment on the calculation)
ok - when do you need it by?

@U03TY4YJU4X I updated

Crucial point to mention for welcome gift:

the CVA & CVR uplift is only considering that welcome gift campaigns <10% of marketing mix*. This is expected to increase as welcome gift campaigns are further scaled

*checking with marketing for a more precise number based on spend
